ygData.subject: Re: [neat] Yahoo Groups is being deleted
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Ken, I just learned about all this and I m concerned that more than a decade of insightful discussions from the whole community is going to just disappear.

Subject: Re: [neat] Yahoo Groups is being deleted
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=311320802; y=yI5HJ8O1uM0bY44EAiPCOkxKRnjwnV_dlfqV95x28yyGMZC1g9bZXhHT4Q

------=_Part_117288_264873333.1572061447992
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="utf-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi Ken,
 
  I just learned about all this and I'm concerned that more than a decade of insightful discussions from the whole community is going to just disappear. Is this going to happen or there is going to be some archive that will be still accessible in the future? I'm looking forward to join whatever the new place is anyway. I've been working with NEAT ever since I found it and met you and joined this group and it pretty much changed the course of my life for good. I still think this is the most elegant and nicely put NE algorithm there is, and I still use it nowadays for evolving all sorts of graphs beyond neural networks. I'll also be happy to announce the latest features of MultiNEAT there and implementations for some of your recent work (safe mutations, DDFA, though it's implemented mostly on the Python side), plus stuff I tried myself like mixed CNN/NEAT phenotypes. I also have DeepNEAT working, the name should be self-explanatory and it's built around Keras and NetworkX, with Conv la
 yers, LSTM, dense ones, everything, basically any input-output dimensions for nodes (from 1 to 3 though) all mixing together with no issues (the core is a routine transforming a NEAT-evolved NetworkX graph into a Keras model). I pretty much did whatever I could think of there. It was fortunately part of the job for some time. We didn't get anything state of art, but at least I got it all implemented.
  
  So, I guess we'll find each other at the new place.
  
  Best regards,
  Peter








 >-------- Оригинално писмо --------

 >От: "kstanley@... [neat]" neat@yahoogroups.com

 >Относно: Re: [neat] Yahoo Groups is being deleted

 >До:  

 >Изпратено на: 24.10.2019 22:45



  
 
  
   
   
    
      
      
     
Hi Jason, thanks for pointing that out, that's useful!
 However, a problem is that many people likely don't know that, and therefore there are many members who never see any posts and don't realize they are missing them.
 And we can't set up the group itself to auto-notify, as far as I know.
 I still support starting a new Google Group, though by all means we can keep the FB group going. It sort of has its own slightly different scope anyway (more focused on announcements than discussion per se). 
      
      

      
      
      Best,
      
      
      

      
      
      ken

<HTML><BODY>
Hi Ken, <div><br></div><div>I just learned about all this=
 and I'm concerned that more than a decade of insightful discussions from t=
he whole community is going to just disappear. Is this going to happen or t=
here is going to be some archive that will be still accessible in the futur=
e? I'm looking forward to join whatever the new place is anyway. I've been =
working with NEAT ever since I found it and met you and joined this group a=
nd it pretty much changed the course of my life for good. I still think thi=
s is the most elegant and nicely put NE algorithm there is, and I still use=
 it nowadays for evolving all sorts of graphs beyond neural networks. I'll =
also be happy to announce the latest features of MultiNEAT there and implem=
entations for some of your recent work (safe mutations, DDFA, though it's i=
mplemented mostly on the Python side), plus stuff I tried myself like mixed=
 CNN/NEAT phenotypes. I also have DeepNEAT working, the name should be self=
-explanatory and it's built around Keras and NetworkX, with Conv layers, LS=
TM, dense ones, everything, basically any input-output dimensions for nodes=
 (from 1 to 3 though) all mixing together with no issues (the core is a rou=
tine transforming a NEAT-evolved NetworkX graph into a Keras model). I pret=
ty much did whatever I could think of there. It was fortunately part of the=
 job for some time. We didn't get anything state of art, but at least I got=
 it all implemented. </div><div><br></div><div>So, I guess we'll find =
each other at the new place. </div><div><br></div><div>Best regards,&n=
bsp;</div><div>Peter<br><br><br><br>
